intro: Lotononis leobordea var. abyssinica, commonly known as the Abyssinian lotononis, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its foliage consists of small, hairy leaves that help reduce water loss. This variety is of interest to botanists and horticulturists due to its unique morphology and potential ecological significance.
